r.d:
These functions allow you to access records stored in dBase-format (dbf) databases.
There is no support for indexes or memo fields. The databases are automatically locked with blocking flock()s.
dBase files are simple sequential files of fixed length records. Records are appended to the end of the file and deleted records are kept until you call dbase_pack().
r.n:
Security Fixes
- Fixed #78668 (Out-of-bounds Read in dbase.c)
Bug Fixes
- Fixed #78070 (dbase functions may modify passed array) - Fixed #78594 (compile error: 'LOCK_EX' undeclared)
